dialogues.text: You aren't the Messiah? The people say you are,

dialogues.speaker: JESUS
dialogues.text: My kingdom is not of this earth,

dialogues.speaker: PILATE
dialogues.text: Oh yeah? Where is it then? In the air, maybe?

dialogues.speaker: JESUS
dialogues.text: In heaven.

dialogues.speaker: PILATE
dialogues.text: Good. You can have it. And take the Jews with you. They're disgusting. They never wash, you know. The Roman soldiers chuckle; they appreciate the Procurato sense of humor.

dialogues.speaker: JESUS
dialogues.text: God has raised his fist over Rome.

dialogues.speaker: PILATE
dialogues.text: (blase) Rome is immortal, They tell me you do miracles. Is this good magic or bad magic? Can you do a trick for us?

dialogues.speaker: JESUS
dialogues.text: I'm not a pet. I don't do tricks, (MORE) (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: JESUS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: But I'll tell you a vision the prophet Daniel had. A huge statue had a head of gold, its breast was of silver...

dialogues.speaker: PILATE
dialogues.text: (interrupts) Wait a second, Jew. You're going to tell me a parable. M not one of your goddamn peasants.

dialogues.speaker: JESUS
dialogues.text: Listen. Learn. There's an awkward moment.

dialogues.speaker: PILATE
dialogues.text: (sighs) Okay, tell me this vision.

dialogues.speaker: JESUS
dialogues.text: The stomach was of bronze, the legs of iron and the feet of clay. A stone was thrown. It broke the earthen feet and the statue collapsed. God is the thrower; I am the stone. Rome is the statue.

dialogues.speaker: PILATE
dialogues.text: Oh, give me a break. I understand what you're up to. You insult Rome so I'll crucify you and you can become a martyr like the others. Your kind come and go. How are you going to bring down Rome? Jesus starts to speak, then stops. He suddenly realizes he doesn't know what to say,

dialogues.speaker: JESUS, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: God, what is the answer? I don't know what to say. :

dialogues.speaker: PILATE
dialogues.text: Just as I thought. Another hustler. Do you make any money out of this?

dialogues.speaker: JESUS, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Please speak to me. I need words. A pain suddenly surges through the back of Jesus' head. He holds his neck. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: PILATE
dialogues.text: Get out of here. Leave me alone. My wife dreams of you -- that shows you how stupid women are. Jesus, confused, humiliated, is led away,

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus is released. Judas waits for him.

dialogues.speaker: JUDAS
dialogues.text: What happened? Jesus has no answer. He just walks off. Judas follows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Golgotha -- "hill of the skull.” The name is not Metaphorical. In 4 B.C., two thousand Jews were crucified in Jerusalem in one day alone. The walls of the city hove nearby. Judas, who has been looking for Jesus, finds him alone on the bald hill. He sits beside hin. Rgmnants of rotting timber are scattered over the stones.

dialogues.speaker: JUDAS
dialogues.text: I've been looking all over for you. For two days you haven't talked to anyone. We're heartsick. What did Pilate want? Jesus collects his thoughts.

dialogues.speaker: JESUS
dialogues.text: Judas, I have a terrible secret to tell you. (Judas waits) I'll tell you because you's: the strongest of my companions. Only you will be able to hear it.

dialogues.speaker: JUDAS
dialogues.text: Thank you for trusting me, Master. Speak. Whatever it is, I can take it.

dialogues.speaker: JESUS
dialogues.text: You know why I came to Jerusalem? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: JUDAS
dialogues.text: Yes, this is where the revolution will happen. Jesus sweating profusely, nods.

dialogues.speaker: JESUS
dialogues.text: The Lord's flames are all around me. I can no longer sleep. I come to this rock, Golgotha, and lie awake. Last night Isaiah came to me.

dialogues.speaker: JUDAS
dialogues.text: (eager) What did he say?

dialogues.speaker: JESUS
dialogues.text: (trembling) He opened his book and I read in dant letters: ‘He has borne our aults; he was wounded for our transgressions. He was afflicted, yet he opened not his mouth. Despised and rejected, he went forward without resisting like a lamb led to the slaughter.' Jesus, pale, sinks his head into his hands. He starts to cry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't understand.

dialogues.speaker: JESUS
dialogues.text: Judas, my dear brother, I'm the lamb. I'm the one who is going to die.

dialogues.speaker: JUDAS
dialogues.text: You? You mean you're not the Messiah?

dialogues.speaker: JESUS
dialogues.text: I am.

dialogues.speaker: JUDAS
dialogues.text: (jumps up) No. That can't be.

dialogues.speaker: JESUS
dialogues.text: Don't shout. It will become clear to you. [I didn't understand at first.

dialogues.speaker: JUDAS
dialogues.text: But every day you have a different plan. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: JESUS .
dialogues.text: I can't help it. That's how God comes to me. Now I finally understand. All my life something has been following me: footsteps, voices, headaches, a shadow. Now I know the shadow is the cross,

dialogues.speaker: JUDAS
dialogues.text: I don't believe you.

dialogues.speaker: JESUS
dialogues.text: I hope you're right. Be patient with me. Tell no one about this conversation. Promise me that.

dialogues.speaker: JUDAS
dialogues.text: Yes, Master.

dialogues.speaker: JESUS
dialogues.text: Good, I knew I could count on you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Philip and Nathaniel walk along a narrow street. Bethany, even though a small village, seems overcrowded. .

dialogues.speaker: NATHANIEL
dialogues.text: What do you want?

dialogues.speaker: PHILIP
dialogues.text: What do you mean?

dialogues.speaker: NATHANIEL
dialogues.text: When we set up the new government.

dialogues.speaker: PHILIP
dialogues.text: (thinks) Well, I guess I'd like more sheep. Only now a large herd. I'd hire other shepherds to take care of them. You know, Laban, that man who has a large ranch north of Tiberias? I'd like a spread like that.

dialogues.speaker: NATHANTEL
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: PHILIP
dialogues.text: How about you? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: NATHANTEL
dialogues.text: First off, I'g like to be able to worship in the temple. I mean really worship -- without Roman banners and soldiers standing around.

dialogues.speaker: PHILIP
dialogues.text: (nods) Of course. What else? As Nathaniel contemplates his answer, Thomas runs to gree them,

dialogues.speaker: THOMAS
dialogues.text: The Master has returned! He's at Martha and Mary's house. They rush down the street. Thomas leads the way. CUT To:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The disciples Sather around Jesus in the courtyard. Mary and Martha serve olives, bread, cheese and water. The disciples are in a festive mood as Thomas, Philip and Nathaniel enter. Jesus, although the center of attraction, is strangely silent, The newcomers eagerly greet him. Judas and Magdalene confer in the corner of the courtyard

dialogues.speaker: MAGDALENE
dialogues.text: What's bothering him? Tell me. Tecan't, He swore me to secrecy,

dialogues.speaker: MAGDALENE
dialogues.text: You can tell me. I'd never breathe a word,

dialogues.speaker: JUDAS
dialogues.text: No,

dialogues.speaker: MAGDALENE
dialogues.text: Why did he choose you anyway? You're nothing but a trouble-maker. |. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: JUDAS .
dialogues.text: Who do you think he should have chosen? That windmill Peter? Maybe that idiot John? Maybe even you -- a woman! He chose me because I'm strong. Magdalene, hurt, goes inside the house. Judas walks over to Philip who is standing alone.

dialogues.speaker: JUDAS
dialogues.text: Do you have your dagger?

dialogues.speaker: PHILIP
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: JUDAS
dialogues.text: Good. Carry it all the time. The Messiah is going to march on Jerusalem next Sabbath.

dialogues.speaker: PHILIP
dialogues.text: He is?

dialogues.speaker: JUDAS
dialogues.text: He told me. How many men can you et together? I know about a lozen. I mean strong men, willing to die,

dialogues.speaker: PHILIP
dialogues.text: From Bethany and Jericho, maybe five or six. But they're all Zealots,

dialogues.speaker: JUDAS
dialogues.text: Good, Go and get them. We'll need all the men we can pet when we go to Jerusalem. If there's enough of us, we'll get more inside the city. There is a commotion where Jesus sits. They turn and look Magdalene, having washed Jesus' feet and dried them with her hair, now anoints them with perfume. Thomas, ever the merchant, objects:

dialogues.speaker: THOMAS
dialogues.text: Master, why do you let her do this? We could have sold this perfume and given the money to the poor. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Jesus speaks with a new air of authority: ‘quieter, but more forceful.

dialogues.speaker: JESUS
dialogues.text: You'll always have the poor, Thomas, but you won't always have me. Jesus bends over and kisses the top of Magdalene’s head. Then he takes her hand, instructing her to rise.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: I don't like it, Rabbi. The perfume makes you smell like you're already dead and waiting to be buried.

dialogues.speaker: JESUS -
dialogues.text: Don't be so afraid of death, John. Death is a key; it opens the door. (to Magdelened Here, sit beside me. I'm lonesome. Tell me stories about when we were children. Magdalene sits beside Jesus, Mary hands him a wine flask. He takes a sip and passes it on. CUT To:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus is on the march. Judas, Philip and Peter lead a group of ruffians twenty strong. Behind them the disciples and the entourage follows. Philip turns to Judas:

dialogues.speaker: PHILIP
dialogues.text: I'm worried about Jesus.

dialogues.speaker: JUDAS
dialogues.text: You don't know him like I do, It looks likz he blows this way, then the other, but when the time comes, he'll give the command. His indecision is over,

dialogues.speaker: PHILIP
dialogues.text: (looks around) There aren't many of us, (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: JUDAS
dialogues.text: Just wait. When Jesus calls, there's gonna be such a mob you'll have to push your way through. Behind them, John, Andrew and Thomas argue:

dialogues.speaker: THOMAS
dialogues.text: I'm not afraid. . JOHN. Then don't act like it.

dialogues.speaker: THOMAS
dialogues.text: I'll do anything the Master asks -- anything but get crucified.

dialogues.speaker: ANDREW
dialogues.text: You're a coward,

dialogues.speaker: THOMAS
dialogues.text: I'd like to see you say that after you've been hanging up there two days and the crows come by and pull out your eyes.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: I made my decision. If you can't make yours, leave now. But the Kingdom lies ahead.

dialogues.speaker: THOMAS
dialogues.text: (touches his chest) I'm ready. I have my knife. CUT To:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus and his followers pass through Sheep's Gate. Their arrival has been heralded in advance: crowds line the narrow road into the city. The mob has come prepared, palm branches in hand. They throw the branches in front of Jesus' processional, Someone provides a donkey, another throws a blanket over its back. Jesus climbs astride the mule. The crowd cheers as Jesus and the disciples pass: "Hosanna, Hosanga!" Jesus' followers are perhaps a hundred strong. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: A new chant’-- abetted by Judas and his followers -- goes up: ‘Jesus of Nazareth, King of the Jews!" The procession moves down the cobblestone lane toward the temple until it reaches Solomon's Porch, Jesus dismounts and looks around. Outside the temple walls, stalls occupy every nook and cranny. Hundreds of people are selling, buying, bargainin hawking their wares: merchants, money-changers, innkeeper Prostitutes. Jesus, full of rage, followed by the disciples, sweeps do on the wine stands and workshops, overturning the tables, striking the tradesmen with his goad.

dialogues.speaker: JESUS
dialogues.text: . Get out! Away! The mob enthusiastically follows suit, looting stalls and routing merchants,

dialogues.speaker: JESUS, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: God, whatever Your plan, tell me now, Quickly -- while I have the strength. Jesus enters the temple grounds. This is his moment . The whole world waits. He calls out:

dialogues.speaker: JESUS
dialogues.text: I have come to set fire to the world! In the desert The Baptist said, ‘Repent, Repent!' The Day of the Lord is coming!' But I say it's already too late to repent. The Day of the Lord is already here. T am the Day of the Lord. 1 come with the baptism of fire! The ragamiffins reply: "Fire! Fire -- burn it 411 down!" The TEMPLE GUARDS (usually Levites) 26 grab their lances swords. Judas' cohorts draw their weapons. Battle is imminent. The paving stones will soon be covere with Jewish blood. Suddenly, the Roman sentries blow their trumpets from the Antonia tower. CAIAPHAS, the high priest, commands the Temple Guards to put down their weapons and withdraw. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: There is no longer anyone for the rebels to attack: The Levites are in the temple, the Romans in the palace. Peter grabs a torch from the wall: SAUL, a man of Tarsus, stands by Caiaphas.

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: Let's go! Now's the time. Although his followers have numerical strength, Jesus temains passive. The disciples turn to him -- waiting for a signal. Instead, Jesus looks at the ground.

dialogues.speaker: JUDAS
dialogues.text: Master, give us the signal.

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: Decide! Jesus closes his eyes. John comes up to him:

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: If you don't give the sign now, we're finished. What we've done - today means death.

dialogues.speaker: JESUS, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: I'm also waiting. Put the ax in my hands.

dialogues.speaker: PHILIP
dialogues.text: We came to fight. Jesus looks at his hands: blood oozes from his palms. He closes his fists to hide the stigmata.

dialogues.speaker: JESUS
dialogues.text: (to Judas) Come beside me. Judas puts his arm around Jesus: s What's wrong? We mstn't let them be ashamed of us.

dialogues.speaker: JESUS
dialogues.text: Stay by my side. He waves to the disciples,

dialogues.speaker: JESUS
dialogues.text: Com'on. Let's go. The disciples, confused, in shock, turn to follow Jesus. One of the spectators throws an olive at them. The “revolt" is a fiasco, (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: ANDREW
dialogues.text: What's happening? James leads the donkey. Peter hurries alongside Jesus and Judas.

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: (to Judas) Can't you see the mess we're in?

dialogues.speaker: JESUS
dialogues.text: Peter, I want you to prepare for the paschal dinner. (to others) Before our ancestors left Egypt, they celebrated Passover. We will celebrate the New Passover before we escape from slavery. The crowd begins to dissipate. The show's over.

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: But, Rabbi, Passover without a lamb is impossible. Where will I get it?

dialogues.speaker: JESUS
dialogues.text: (bitter) The lamb is ready. At this very moment he's proceeding to the slaughter all on his own. Don't worry about the lamb.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The city is alive with Passover preparations. One house- holder lights his lanterns; another hurrjgs down the street with a basket of bread and fruit. Jesus and Judas walk past a fountain in a small square. They watch suspiciously as a woman draws a bucket of wate They stop at a selected spot between two trees. John approaches:

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: Peter said to tell you everything was ready for Passover.

dialogues.speaker: JESUS
dialogues.text: Thanks. Tell him we'll be right there.

dialogues.speaker: JOEN
dialogues.text: Be sure to take the alley route. The Romans are looking all over for us. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Jesus nods. After John leaves, Jesus turns confidentially to Judas:

dialogues.speaker: JESUS
dialogues.text: Try to be brave, I'm trying too.

dialogues.speaker: . JUDAS
dialogues.text: Are you sure there's no other way?

dialogues.speaker: JESUS
dialogues.text: (shakes head) No. I'm sorry.

dialogues.speaker: JUDAS
dialogues.text: No other way?

dialogues.speaker: JESUS
dialogues.text: I would have liked another one, too. I kept hoping -- until now. There is no other way. The end of the world is here. This world, the kingdom of Satan, will be destroyed and the kingdom of heaven will come. How? By my death.

dialogues.speaker: JUDAS
dialogues.text: IT won't let you die. Jesus grasps his arm and says sternly:

dialogues.speaker: JESUS
dialogues.text: You once made me a promise. You said if I ever strayed, if I ever shied away from revolution, you would kill me. Remember? | (Judas nods) I have strayed, haven't I?

dialogues.speaker: JUDAS
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: JESUS
dialogues.text: Then you must keep your word. Go to Caiaphas. The Temple Guards want to arrest me where there aren't any crowds. Tonight we'll be in Gethsemane. Arrange for them to find me at the three-rock point.

dialogues.speaker: JUDAS
dialogues.text: No, I couldn't.

dialogues.speaker: JESUS
dialogues.text: You must. Don't abandon me now.

dialogues.speaker: JUDAS
dialogues.text: But if you were me, could you betray your master? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: JESUS
dialogues.text: (thinks) No. But that's why God gave me the easier job -- to be crucified.

dialogues.speaker: JUDAS
dialogues.text: Do the others know?

dialogues.speaker: JESUS
dialogues.text: No, I'll tell them tonight. Night has fallen. Jesus and Judas take a circuitous route toward the meeting place. The traditional Passover psalm echoes from behind closed doors they pass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Judas taps a secret knock. Peter opens the door cautiousl and lets them enter. A high window lets moonlight into the large room. Three seven-branched candelabra illuminate the lamb, wine and unleavened bread. The disciples are seated on cushions around three sides o a square table. The fourth is open to facilitate serving. Jesus takes his place at the center of the table. Mary, Martha and Magdalene have all come to Jerusalem to celebrate the festival with Jesus and his disciples and prepare the ritual meal. Jesus fills the disciples’ cups from a pitcher of salt wa

dialogues.speaker: JESUS
dialogues.text: First we must drink salt water to remember the tears and pain our ancestors suffered in the land of Egypt. Jesus swallows his drink in a single gulp. Mary brings a tray of bitter herbs proscribed by Jewish law: oregano, bay and savory. Jesus watches as the disciples eat:

dialogues.speaker: JESUS
dialogues.text: Passover celebrates the passage from slavery to freedom. Tonight's Passover goes even further: it celebrates the passage from death to eternal life. I will lead the way, you will follow. (MORE) (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: JESUS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (to Matthew) John, you know the prophets. Isaiah says, 'He had neither beauty nor luster that we would turn our eyes to him. He was despised and rejected by me...'

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: (continues) "... But he took on himself all our pains. He was wounded for our transgressions and with his stripes we were healed.'

dialogues.speaker: JESUS
dialogues.text: (interrupting) ',.. He was scourged and afflicted yet, like a lamb led to the slaughter, he opened not his mouth.' {a beat) My dear, wonderful friends. I am the lamb. And I will not open my mouth. The disciples exchange fearful glances.

dialogues.speaker: PHILIP
dialogues.text: I don't understand. We didn't come to Jerusalem to die, we came to rule.

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: If you die, I'll die first. Because I will be at your side.

dialogues.speaker: JESUS
dialogues.text: Be quiet. What did you have before I found you? Nothing. (no answer) : Now you have God's love -- and eternal life. Don't worry. You won't die yet. There's still a lot of work to do. We haven't come to rule, but to serve. I'll tise from the dead to lead you. The disciples stare in shocked silence. Jesus has either gone completely mad -- or he is the Messiah. Jesus breaks the bread loaves and passes them around. He pours wine for the others:

dialogues.speaker: JESUS
dialogues.text: Take and eat; this is my body. Drink, this is my blood. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: As they do, the bread and the wine transubstantiate into flesh and blood in their mouths. Peter is the first to cough up the bloody flesh. The others, sickened, follow. They wipe their bloody mouths. John starts to weep. Jesus turns to Judas.

dialogues.speaker: JESUS
dialogues.text: Go and do what you promised. As Judas exits, Peter says angrily:

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: Where is he going?

dialogues.speaker: JESUS
dialogues.text: Don't stop him. The wheel is already in motion. Tonight we'll go to Gethsemane to pray. CuT To:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus and the disciples, cross the Kidron River and appro Gethsemane, a 3-acre park on the eastern slope of the Mou of Olives. Just east of the walls, the Kidron Valley lies between Jerusalem and the Mount of Olives. Today, as then, it is a necropolis "outside the walls." As they walk, Jesus and his disciples pass the monumental Hellenistic tombs of "Bene Hezir" and "Absalom" -- silent testimonials which still stand today. As they climb the steep hills of Gethsemane, Jesus leaves most of his group behind and proceeds with Peter, James and John. Passing through thick, gnarled olive groves, they reach a clearing marked by three boulders.

dialogues.speaker: JESUS
dialogues.text: Wait for me here. Jesus walks alone until he finds a secluded spot. Pulling his tunic around him, he kneels beneath an ancient tree. Jesus' self-control, which had been superhuman to this point, melts away. His body shakes; sweat drops from his forehead down his cheeks.

dialogues.speaker: JESUS
dialogues.text: Abba, Father, we've been together a2 long time. I've had many doubts. (MORE) (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: JESUS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I never asked to be chosen, but I always obeyed. I turned on mother, I gave up Magdalene. I've never had a family, never had a bed to sleep in. I've never made love with a woman. Nightmares and hallucinations have followed me my whole life. Jesus, exhausted, pauses. He looks down, takes a breath, and continues:

dialogues.speaker: JESUS
dialogues.text: You've done many miracles. You opened the Red Sea, saved Noah; you took Elijah directly to heaven in a fiery chariot. Now you ask Me to take crucifixion and hold it in my lips like a thorny rose. Is death the only answer for me? Is there no way you can take this bitter cup from my hands? Jesus waits for the answer that doesn't come. He looks one way, then the other. The wind blows sadly through the trees. A GUARDIAN ANGEL in the form of a nine-year-old girl appears, She sets a silver chalice before Jesus.

dialogues.speaker: JESUS, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Is this your answer? The Angel drinks from the cup, then hands it to Jesus. As she does, she and the cup vanish.

dialogues.speaker: JESUS, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Your will be done. I only ask for strength. Jesus wipes the sweat and tears from his face. He pulls himself to his feet, heads back. At the three-csock point he finds Peter, James and John fast asleep. John's head rests peacefully on his brother's chest. Jesus is tempted not to wake them.

dialogues.speaker: JESUS
dialogues.text: (softly) Couldn't you stay awake with me for just an hour? Peter is the first to awake. Ashamed, he falls at Jesus' eet. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: Forgive me. Jesus hears the sound of soldiers in the distance.

dialogues.speaker: JESUS
dialogues.text: It doesn't matter. It's too late. The time has come. Jesus hears the evening nightingale overhead. He smells the vernal perfumes of the garden. A feeling of peace sweeps over him. He smiles at James and John as they awaken. Judas and a band of armed Temple Guards and Romans burst into the clearing. Peter pulls his dagger; Jesus pushes him back. Judas greets his master:

dialogues.speaker: JUDAS
dialogues.text: Welcome, Rabbi. Judas kisses him fiercely on the mouth. Jesus embraces his faithful disciple. Tears stream down Judas' cheeks. Peter pulls his knife and slices off one of the Temple Guard's ears. This is not random but calculated violence because a Levite cannot serve as a Temple Guard if he is physically deformed. Peter's reaction is not one of disappointment, but achievement. As if saying, "So there. Jesus pushes Judas unwillingly away, picks up the severed ear off the ground and miraculously restores it to the Le

dialogues.speaker: JESUS
dialogues.text: (to Peter) Welcome the messengers of God. (to Soldiers) Let's go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus again stands before Pilate. He is bloody, beaten, exhausted from lack of sleep. A clique of Temple Guards, Pharisees and Sadducees stand in one corner of the court- yard.

dialogues.speaker: PILATE
dialogues.text: I knew we'd meet again. They tell Me you say you call yourself a king. Is that right? (Jesus doesn't answer) Speak up. I have the power to erucify you. Are you a king? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: JESUS
dialogues.text: I could tell you that my kingdom is not on earth, but you wouldn't understand that. However, I will tell you that I hold you, Rome, heaven and earth in the palm of this one hand. He extends arm. Pilate, unbelieving, turns to the Jewish leaders:

dialogues.speaker: PILATE
dialogues.text: Where were you Jews when they handed out brains? The soldiers laugh, but the Jewish heirarchy will not be distracted. 28

dialogues.speaker: SADDUCEE
dialogues.text: He must die. Your Majesty. He wants the people to revolt.

dialogues.speaker: PILATE
dialogues.text: (shrugs) Of course. I don't care either way. Just another dead Jew. Crucify him -- or whatever else. First have some fun with him. If he wants to be king, we'll make him one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roman soldiers lead Jesus onto the balcony overlooking Solomon's Porch and present him to the awaiting mob. He has been whipped; his white tunic is drenched with blood. A crown of thorns drips blood down his face. A Centurion announces:

dialogues.speaker: JERUSALEM CENTURION
dialogues.text: Behold the man! Behold your king! The crowd hoots with laughter and scorn. Jesus does not react. A BEGGER turns to Peter:

dialogues.speaker: BEGGAR
dialogues.text: I know you. You're one of his followers.

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: No. It must be someone else.

dialogues.speaker: BEGGER
dialogues.text: No, it's you. .

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: You're crazy. Peter turns quickly and disappears in the crowd. cuT TO:  66 67 68 77.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peter is running down an alley when, turning a comer, he runs into Philip, also fleeing. They don't even speak. After a fleeting recognition, they sprint in opposite directions.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roman soldiers lead Jesus through the peasant streets of Golgotha. Like the Zealot of Nazareth, Jesus bears his cross as he struggles across his rocky doloroga. The blood has dried on his tunic. He still wears his thor "crown." The sympathies of the rabble have shifted. Now it's just another show: a multiple crucifixion. Laughter, ridicule, figs for sale. Jesus weakens. His knees buckle and he falls. The soldiers conscript a bystander to carry the cross as they lead Jesus forward. .

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A curious crowd has already assembled at the crucifixion site. Toward the rear, afraid to approach # Magdalene, Ma Martha and Jesus' Mother stand in a tight group. The Romans bring Jesus to the peak of the hill and strip him naked. Two other criminals are prepared for crucifixi Jesus looks at the rough-hewn cross laid before him. He searches the crowd. -

dialogues.speaker: JESUS, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Mother? Magdalene? Where are you? He spots his Mother and waves to her:

dialogues.speaker: JESUS, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: (continuing) Farewell. Forgive me for being a bad son. Saul, arrogant, his hands on his hips, stands watching. Two SOLDIERS grab Jesus by the arms: (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: FIRST SOLDIER
dialogues.text: Alright, Your Majesty, it's time to get on your throne. They stretch Jesus out on the cross while slave laborers finish preparing the post hole for the cross.

dialogues.speaker: JESUS, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Don't give up on me. The Soldiers place the crude spikes against Jesus' palms. The sound of METAL AGAINST METAL rings out as the hammer comes down. A bloody mist sprays on Jesus' face. He grimaces but does not cry out. Martha and the three Marys hide their faces. Near Jesus, the other criminals are being impaled. The Romans fasten ropes around Jesus' arms. The spikes alone will not support his weight. It takes three soldiers to hoist'Jesus' cross upright. No suddenly, he is above the masses. All of Jerusalem is within view. In the distance he sees the temple. The outer veil glows the midday sun, a blood-red vision. His body jars into place. The pain is excruciating. His fellow criminals howl in agony. Jesus surveys the mob: a sea of hostile faces. He finds Magdalene, Mary, Martha and his Mother standing in a grou His heart goes out to Magdalene. The Sadducees are satisfied; the Romans are complacent. Groups of townspeople and schoolboys point out the suffer ings of the condemned men.

dialogues.speaker: JESUS, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: (continuing) Father, forgive them. The sky changes color. Horses buckle wder their riders; DOGS BARK. A fierce wind blows across the rocky hill. The earth trembles. Spectators turn and rin. Jesus looks to heaven. From the depths of his bowels he screams: (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: JESUS
dialogues.text: Eli, Eli... And faints.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sky turns a pleasant pale blue. Jesus looks up at the thick white cumul ous clouds floating on the horizon. Birds sing in the distance. He thinks: Am I dead? No, the crowd is still there, SILEN On either side of Jesus, his fellow criminals writhe in silent agony. The Angel from Gethsemane appears before him. He has seen many angels in his life, but never one as beautiful as th Her soft blonde hair falls on her shoulders. In the garde he was too frightened to notice her true beauty.

dialogues.speaker: JESUS
dialogues.text: Who are you?

dialogues.speaker: GUARDIAN ANGEL
dialogues.text: I'm your guardian angel. Remember when God told Abraham to sacrifice his son? Just as Abraham lifted the knife, God spared Isaac. Your father sent me here. He is God of mercy, not punishment. He saw you and said, 'Take care of him. He's suffered enough.' He tested you -- and is pleased. He doesn't want your blood. Come with me. In a moment Jesus and the Guardian Angel are standing at the foot of the cross. They pass through the silent crowd unnoticed. Jesus looks over his shoulder: his cross is empty.

dialogues.speaker: JESUS
dialogues.text: (relieved) You mean I'm not the Messiah?

dialogues.speaker: GUARDIAN ANGEL
dialogues.text: No. Jesus smiles: he is finally free of God.

dialogues.speaker: JESUS
dialogues.text: Where are the disciples? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: GUARDIAN ANGEL
dialogues.text: They have fled in fear. cur To:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They walk through the pleasant landscape of the Jordan Valley. All is quiet, péaceful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is this the Kingdom of God I spoke about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: . (laughing) No, this is earth.

dialogues.speaker: JESUS
dialogues.text: Why has it changed so much?

dialogues.speaker: GUARDIAN ANGEL
dialogues.text: It hasn't changed, you have. You can now see its true beauty. You may find this hard to believe, but often us angels look down on mankind and envy then. Ahead Jesus sees a group in ceremonial dress. Virgins dressed in white, merchants carrying incense and gifts.

dialogues.speaker: JESUS
dialogues.text: What is this?

dialogues.speaker: GUARDIAN ANGEL
dialogues.text: A wedding ceremony.

dialogues.speaker: JESUS
dialogues.text: Who's getting married?

dialogues.speaker: GUARDIAN ANGEL
dialogues.text: You are. Mary Magdalene, dressed in white, steps from the group. Jesus' face bursts into a smile. He rushes into her arms.

dialogues.speaker: JESUS
dialogues.text: Magdalene, my love.

dialogues.speaker: MAGDALENE
dialogues.text: (kissing him) Jesus. (CONT INUED)

dialogues.speaker: JESUS
dialogues.text: I've waited for this moment so long. (Magdalene starts to sry) What's wrong? Why are you crying?

dialogues.speaker: MAGDALENE
dialogues.text: I'm so happy. I'm crying for joy -- and thanks. Thanks to God for bringing you here. (they embrace again) We must hide. Everyone is looking for you. Pilate is furious. I know where we can be safe. He holds her tight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A small hut near the Jordan. Moonlight shimmers off the river. The Guardian Angel sits on a stool in front of the door. cuUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus and Magdalene make love on blankets spreei over str He kisses her breasts, her lips.

dialogues.speaker: MAGDALENE
dialogues.text: I feel like I've just been born. qhac this is the first day of my ife.

dialogues.speaker: JESUS
dialogues.text: I never knew the world was so beautiful. I was blind. (kisses her breasts again) I didn’t know that the body was so holy. But now I understand.

dialogues.speaker: MAGDALENE
dialogues.text: Understand what?

dialogues.speaker: JESUS
dialogues.text: That this is the road.

dialogues.speaker: MAGDALENE
dialogues.text: What road? (CONT INUED)

dialogues.speaker: JESUS
dialogues.text: The road on which the mortal becomes immortal, God becomes human. I was so stupid: I tried to find a way outside my own flesh. I wanted clouds, great ideas, death. But now I know: a woman is God's greatest work. And I worship you. God sleeps between your legs.

dialogues.speaker: MAGDALENE
dialogues.text: I want to have a child with you.

dialogues.speaker: JESUS
dialogues.text: Me too. Magdalene hears a noise at the door.

dialogues.speaker: MAGDALENE
dialogues.text: What's that? The Guardian Angel steps into the darkened room.

dialogues.speaker: GUARDIAN ANGEL
dialogues.text: It's me. I wondered if I could watch. I'm lonely too.

dialogues.speaker: JESUS
dialogues.text: (laughs) Yes, yes. Watch. Jesus resumes lovemaking. cUuT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: fhe house shows signs of domestication: -wine jugs, a wor ench. Magdalene, several months pregnant, steps outside to shak out a blanket. SAUL, a short balding man, walks toward her with three Temple Guards. Magdalene senses something is wrong. She looks around for Jesus or his Angel. They are nowhere to be found. The Guards surround her.

dialogues.speaker: SAUL
dialogues.text: Here she is. The famous Magdalene. (MORE) (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: SAUL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Whore of the Nazarene. (grabs her hair) You thought you could hide from me.

dialogues.speaker: MAGDALENE
dialogues.text: Who are you?

dialogues.speaker: SAUL
dialogues.text: (arrogant) I'm Saul, sent from Damascus to kill your lover -- that's who I am. He won't get away again. Tell me where he is.

dialogues.speaker: MAGDALENE
dialogues.text: I'don't know what you're talking about. I hear he died in Jerusalem. Leave me alone.

dialogues.speaker: SAUL
dialogues.text: (taps her belly) And where did you get this?

dialogues.speaker: MAGDALENE
dialogues.text: You're from Damascus. You should know.

dialogues.speaker: SAUL
dialogues.text: Tell us -- or we'll kill you.

dialogues.speaker: MAGDALENE
dialogues.text: How can I tell you what I don't know? One of the Levites picks up a rock.

dialogues.speaker: FIRST GUARD
dialogues.text: Stop lying, you slut. Tell us. Magdalene turns and starts to rum. The Guard throws the rock, hitting her square in the back. She falls to the ground. Saul and the Guards pick up stones and throw them as they walk toward her.

dialogues.speaker: SAUL
dialogues.text: (throwing) Here's for the lips that've kissed a thousand men. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: The rock breaks Magdalene's jaw. The Guard throws another rock.

dialogues.speaker: FIRST LEVITE
dialogues.text: 4nd this is for your worn-out tits!

dialogues.speaker: SECOND GUARD
dialogues.text: (joining in) And for your belly! Magdalene's blood flows in every direction. Saul and the Guards, satisfied, turn to search the house. FADE OUT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Guardian Angel furtively leads Jesus through the deserted Bethany streets. The Angel glances one way, the other. Jesus is distraught. He has just discovered Magdalene's body. Her blood is on his fingers and tunic. He tries to go back but the Angel pulls him ahead.

dialogues.speaker: GUARDIAN ANGEL
dialogues.text: Come. They turn the corner to Mary and Martha's house. cur To:

dialogues.speaker: MARTHA
dialogues.text: Mary, look! It's Jesus. It's a miracle. The Guardian Angel closes the door behind them, remaining in the shadows. Jesus steps into the center of the room.

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: (touching him) Is it really you?

dialogues.speaker: JESUS
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: MARTHA
dialogues.text: Come by the fire where we can get a better look at you. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Mary takes his hands.

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: What's this? Jesus examines the dried blood on his fingers.

dialogues.speaker: JESUS
dialogues.text: I'm in danger. The Temple Guards want me. ey killed Magdalene. Martha gasps.

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: What will we do? They'll find you here. The Angel calls to Jesus.

dialogues.speaker: GUARDIAN ANGEL
dialogues.text: Psst. Jesus goes over to her.

dialogues.speaker: GUARDIAN ANGEL
dialogues.text: Master, I'm sorry about Magdalene. I'll never leave you alone. I'11 always protect you. But I'm afraid I'll attract attention. I'll turn myself into a slave boy. I'11 run errands for you. The Guardian Angel instantly transforms into a ten-year-o Arab servant. He still speaks with the voice of the angelic girl.

dialogues.speaker: GUARDIAN ANGEL
dialogues.text: (continuing) I'll always be at your side. Martha walks over to them.

dialogues.speaker: MARTHA
dialogues.text: You must be hungry. I'11 cook some stew for you and your little friend.

dialogues.speaker: JESUS
dialogues.text: (realizing his negligence) Martha, I've been thinking so much about myself I even forgot to say hello. (MORE) (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: JESUS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Mary, come here. It's so good to see you again. We're all still alive. Thank God. He embraces them both.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They all sit around the fire. Jesus cleans his bowl with a piece of bread. He smiles at Mary. Martha rubs the Angel's curly head.

dialogues.speaker: MARTHA
dialogues.text: Rabbi, I like your little friend.

dialogues.speaker: JESUS
dialogues.text: (expansive) I used to thank heaven, seven heavens were not big enough for me. And now look at this miracle. Can you believe it? A tiny house is big enough for me, a mouthful of bread, the kind words of a woman.

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: But what will happen if they find you here?

dialogues.speaker: JESUS
dialogues.text: I'll change my name. I'll be Lazarus. I raised him from the dead, so what? He died again. Now I am Lazarus. Jesus looks to his Angel for assistance. As Jesus continu to speak, he gradually transforms into a healthy, virile Lazarus. He continues to speak with his old voice. (The actor who played Lazarus assimes Jesus’ role; the ac who plays Jesus dubs the dialogue.) The sisters watch in astonishment.

dialogues.speaker: JESUS
dialogues.text: (continuing) Jesus is dead. Lazarus is reborn. I've changed my body and soul. I now declare war on fasting and suffering and chastity. (MORE) (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: JESUS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I'm through wrestling with God. I'm not going to build crosses any more. I'm going to build cradles and bedsteads. Mary, her eyes welling up, embraces his legs.

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: Rabbi, when I was little the girls sang this song: ‘Whoever gives me a Swallow's egg, I will give him my lips, Whoever gives me an eagle's egg, I'll give him my breasts; And whoever gives me a stab, I'll give him my heart.' Jesus lifts Mary up and embraces her. Martha senses she is unwanted. She starts to leave.

dialogues.speaker: MARTHA
dialogues.text: Excuse me, Rabbi. I've got a feeling that you'll make my sister your wife. But let me stay. Let me breathe the air of married life. I'll make the beds and do the chores. Saying this, Martha walks into another room. Jesus and Mary walk toward the blanket on the ground. The Guardian Angel sits in a darkened corner, watching.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Years heave passed. An older Lazarus (formerly Jesus) sit out front hewing a chair. Two children play nearby. Jesus’ Arab servant sits beside him; he is still a ten-ye old boy. A NEIGHBOR approaches:

dialogues.speaker: NEIGHBOR
dialogues.text: Good afternoon, Lazarus! Jesus waves as the Neighbor passes. The servant boy speak to him -- still in the young girl's voice: (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: GUARDIAN ANGEL
dialogues.text: Are you satisfied with me? Do you have any complaints? Jesus stops working, sets the chair on its side.

dialogues.speaker: JESUS
dialogues.text: None. What a twisted road I took to find God.

dialogues.speaker: GUARDIAN ANGEL
dialogues.text: Don't worry. I won't leave you. I like you. Jesus rests in the sumlight. Martha walks over to them. She has been washing clothes.

dialogues.speaker: JESUS
dialogues.text: Where's Mary?

dialogues.speaker: MARTHA
dialogues.text: Picking olives. She won't be back until this evening. Martha pauses a moment, then takes Jesus' hand.

dialogues.speaker: MARTHA
dialogues.text: (continuing) Let's go inside. It's too hot out here. Jesus stands and puts his arm around Martha's waist. Mart rubs the Guardian Angel's curly head and instructs him:

dialogues.speaker: MARTHA
dialogues.text: (continuing) Watch the children. The Angel. smiles as Jesus and Martha enter the house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Years have passed. Jesus and Martha returm from market with three of their children, ages seven through ten. The Guardian Angel walks with the children. Ahead, Mary sits in front of the house repairing a dress. Two girls play with straw dolls in the dirt beside her. The two youngest children, boys, race’ toward Mary. One snatches a doll from one of the girls as they race off again. Mary scolds them as they go. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: JESUS .
dialogues.text: We're either going to have to stop having children or enlarge the house.

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: (laughs) We'll enlarge the house. A small group has gathered down the road. Someone is speaking in the square. Jesus goes over to check it out. His Angel follows. Paul, formerly Saul, preaches to a handful of villagers. He seems transformed: standing straight, radiating con- fidence. He speaks with the evangelistic fervor of a born-again Christian.

dialogues.speaker: PAUL
dialogues.text: I was once a sinner, the greatest of sinners. You name it, I did it. Whored, drank, murdered -- yes, murdered. Then one day, returning to Damascus, I was struck by a burning light and a voice called to me, 'Saul, why are you persecuting me? What did I ever do to you?’ ‘Who are you?' I said. ‘Jesus,’ the voice replied. Scales fell from my burning eyes. I was baptized and became Paul, the apostle, and now I bring the Good News to every country.

dialogues.speaker: BETHANY VILLAGER
dialogues.text: What good news?

dialogues.speaker: PAUL
dialogues.text: Jesus of Nazareth -- you must have heard of him. He wasn't the son of Mary, he was the son of God. His mother was a virgin. Gabriel came to earth and put God's seed in her womb. He took on our sins, he was tortured, crucified -- but three days later he rose again and ascended to heaven. Death was conquered, praise God! Death was conquered and the Gates of Heaven are now open to everyone. Jesus has been rising to a slow boil. He can restrain himself no longer. He calls out: (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: JESUS
dialogues.text: Did you ever see this resurrected Jesus of Nazareth?

dialogues.speaker: PAUL
dialogues.text: I saw a blinding flash of light and I heard his voice.

dialogues.speaker: JESUS
dialogues.text: Liar!

dialogues.speaker: PAUL
dialogues.text: His disciples saw him. They were hiding in an attic with the doors locked when suddenly he appeared before them. Thomas wasn't convinced but he put his fingers in his wounds and gave him some fish, which he ate.

dialogues.speaker: JESUS
dialogues.text: Liar! Disgusted, Jesus tums and walks away. His Angel follows. Paul excuses himself from his listeners. He and his YOUNG ASSISTANT follow Jesus down the road. Jesus feels Paul's footsteps drawing closer. He's about to explode. Suddenly, he turns on his heel, grabs Paul by the shoulders and shakes him violently.

dialogues.speaker: JESUS
dialogues.text: (continuing) Liar! I'm Jesus of Nazareth. I Was never crucified, never resurrected. I'm a man like everybody else. Why are you spreading these lies? Jesus’ Arab servant tugs at his sleeve. ©

dialogues.speaker: GUARDIAN ANGEL
dialogues.text: Quiet.

dialogues.speaker: PAUL
dialogues.text: You?

dialogues.speaker: JESUS
dialogues.text: Yes, me. Son of Mary and Joseph, who preached in Galilee. James and John, sons of Zebedee, were ny disciples. (MORE) (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: JESUS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: We marched on Jerusalem, I was brought before Pilate but God spared me. Jesus’ Angel doesn't like this conversation; he tugs violently at his sleeve. Jesus shoves him to the ground. Paul takes Jesus aroumd @ corner where they won't be seen

dialogues.speaker: PAUL
dialogues.text: Shut up.

dialogues.speaker: JESUS
dialogues.text: Now I'm a family man. I eat, work, have children. Don't go around the world spreading these lies about me. (shouts I'll tell everyone the truth. Now it's Paul’s tum to explode.

dialogues.speaker: PAUL
dialogues.text: Shut up! Look around you. Look at their suffering and unhappiness. Their only hope is the Resurrected Jesus. I don't care if you are Jesus or not. The Resurrected Jesus will save the world -- that's all that matters,

dialogues.speaker: JESUS
dialogues.text: The world can be saved by lies?

dialogues.speaker: PAUL
dialogues.text: What's 'truth?' I've created truth out of longing and faith. I don't ieruagie to find truth -- I build it. £ it's necessary to save the world to crucify you. then I'll crucify you -- and T'll Fresu-rect you, like it or not. You can stay in your little house. But the rest of the world will Look up in the air and see you crucified. They will weep and their souls will be cleansed. The enemy is death and I'll defeat death by resurrecting you -- Jesus of Nazareth, Son of God, Messiah.

dialogues.speaker: JESUS
dialogues.text: I won't let you. T'12 tell everyone the truth, (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: . PAUL
dialogues.text: Shout all you want. Who will believe you? The wheel you set in Motion can't be stopped. The faithful will grab you and throw you in a burning fire.

dialogues.speaker: JESUS
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: PAUL
dialogues.text: The whole world is before me -- Egypt, Syria, Phoenicia, Greece, Rome. You don't know what a joy it is to set out in the morning, to hold the cross, to put hope in the hearts of men -- all for the sake of Christ. Jesus seems confused -- "almost persuaded" by Paul's logi his mesmerizing enthusiasn.

dialogues.speaker: PAUL
dialogues.text: (continuing) Not you. I'm glad I met you. Now I'm rid of you. (turns to leave) Goodbye, Lazarus. Paul waves to his Assistant as he returns to the town square, calling out:

dialogues.speaker: PAUL
dialogues.text: (continuing) Friends! Listen to me! This is the greatest day of your life. I bring the Good News... Jesus, exhausted, dazed, staggers toward his house. The Guardian Angel faithfully follows. Ahead Mary and Martha wait for him. Jesus collapses into their arms. His Angel takes his hand. Jesus turns to his "family."

dialogues.speaker: JESUS
dialogues.text: Don't ever leave me. I'm happy here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesis is now an old man. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: His skin has wrinkled and yellowed; his béard, white and thin, reaches to his chest. He is now the same withered Lazarus that he had once raised from the dead. He sits in the vine arbor beside the house, basking in the midday su His Guardian Angel, unchanged by time, sits beside hin. Jesus turns to hin:

dialogues.speaker: JESUS
dialogues.text: Remember when Mary and I planted these vines -- how many times have we eaten these grapes?

dialogues.speaker: GUARDIAN ANGEL
dialogues.text: (shrugs) I don't remember. : (pause) You know, Master, the end is near.

dialogues.speaker: JESUS
dialogues.text: What end? Are you leaving me?

dialogues.speaker: GUARDIAN ANGEL
dialogues.text: Yes. The end has come. You've grown old. The SOUNDS OF YELLING AND SCREAMING come from the street. A woman's WAIL pierces the air. Jesus and his servant turn to look. Mary and Martha, aged, rush from the house. Jesus and the Angel stand. .

dialogues.speaker: JESUS
dialogues.text: What's wrong?

dialogues.speaker: MARTHA
dialogues.text: They're burning Jerusalem. The seige is over. The city is destroyed. The Romans are killing everyone.

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: Our sons. Where are they? Jesus takes them by their arms.

dialogues.speaker: JESUS
dialogues.text: Let's go inside. Bolt the doors and windows. They go inside and close the door béhind them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They huddle inside. The cries from the street have diminished. : Jesus cautiously opens the window shutters. The streets are empty; the sky is red in the distance.

dialogues.speaker: MARTHA
dialogues.text: Everyone is fleeing to the south. Mary starts to ery.

dialogues.speaker: JESUS
dialogues.text: Why are you crying? Time is like a fire and God turns the spit. Each year he rotates a paschal lamb. This year Jerusalem, next Rome, next...

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: (interrupts) You don't understand women at all.

dialogues.speaker: JESUS
dialogues.text: I'm sorry. Forgive me. You must be tired. Go to bed. I'll be there shortly. Mary and Martha retire, leaving Jesus alone by the fire with his Guardian Angel. There's a KNOCK on the door. The Arab servant walks over and cautiously opens the door. He turns back and smiles at his master mockingly. Jesus shudders.

dialogues.speaker: JESUS
dialogues.text: Who is it?

dialogues.speaker: GUARDIAN ANGEL
dialogues.text: It's your old friends.

dialogues.speaker: JESUS
dialogues.text: My friends?

dialogues.speaker: GUARDIAN ANGEL
dialogues.text: Your disciples. The Angel opens the door. Jesus strains to see. Four old men inch into the room. Deteriorated and unrecognizable, they lean against each other as if held by glue. The Angel sits on the table watching them. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: . JESUS
dialogues.text: You in front, come here. A feeble man steps forward.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you recognize me, Rabbi?

dialogues.speaker: JESUS
dialogues.text: Peter, is that you? When I was young and foolish, I called you the rock, the rock upon which I would build my church. But now you look more like a sponge. What happened?

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: The years, Master.

dialogues.speaker: JESUS
dialogues.text: (points) And you, Philip, you were so strong and now you've become fat. I loved you, shepherd, you had no sheep. You herded them in your mind.

dialogues.speaker: PHILIP
dialogues.text: I gave into hunger. Jesus points to the mutilated man next to Peter:

dialogues.speaker: JESUS
dialogues.text: And you? They've cut off your nose, your ear, taken out your eye. Who are you?

dialogues.speaker: AMES
dialogues.text: (bows) Rabbi.

dialogues.speaker: JESUS
dialogues.text: James!

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: The Romans tu.cured me and cut away my face. I saw Jerusalem burn. I saw the Ark of the Covenant taken from the temple.

dialogues.speaker: JESUS
dialogues.text: (shocked) The Ark? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: PHILIP
dialogues.text: The Temple is destroyed, just aS you said.

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: There is another, outside.

dialogues.speaker: PHILIP
dialogues.text: Be careful, Rabbi, he's still the same -- full of anger. A large figure steps into the doorway.

dialogues.speaker: JESUS
dialogues.text: Judas! (Judas doesn't answer) Judas, come in. (still no answer) Has it come to this? Time changes everything: men, cities, nations, even gods. Hasn't it changed your anger? (steps forward) Judas, can't you hear?

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: He's still pig~headed.

dialogues.speaker: NATHANIEL
dialogues.text: He's been fighting. His hands are still bloody. Jesus takes another step toward Judas.

dialogues.speaker: PHILIP
dialogues.text: Be careful.

dialogues.speaker: . PETER
dialogues.text: (reprimanding) Judas, the Master is speaking to you. Judas breaks his silence with a loud voice:

dialogues.speaker: JUDAS
dialogues.text: Traitor! Everyone freezes.

dialogues.speaker: JUDAS
dialogues.text: (continuing) Traitor. Your place was on the cross. (MORE) (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: JUDAS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: That's where God put you. But when death came you got scared and ran and hid under the skirts of Mary and Martha. You became a fake Lazarus to save yourself.

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: Don't you have any respect?

dialogues.speaker: JUDAS
dialogues.text: For him? He was supposed to lead an army of angels. Instead he came here to stud women.

dialogues.speaker: JESUS
dialogues.text: Judas, can't you be more kind? JUDAS . Rabbi, you broke my heart. How can I be kind? Sometimes I want to scream and bang my head against a rock and curse the day I ever met you. We held the world in our hands. Remember what you said to me? You took me in your arms and begged me, ‘Betray me, betray me. I must be crucified so I can be resurrected to save the world.' The wounds in Jesus' hands and feet begin to bleed.

dialogues.speaker: JUDAS
dialogues.text: (continuing) ‘I am the lamb,' you bleated. ‘Death is the door. Judas, ny brother, don't be afraid. Help me.’ Judas' eyes fill with moisture.

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: Look at his wounds, Judas. Have mercy.

dialogues.speaker: JUDAS
dialogues.text: He was going to be the New Covenant. Now Israel is no more.

dialogues.speaker: JESUS
dialogues.text: (trembling) But my Guardian Angel... (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: JUDAS ,
dialogues.text: Your Guardian Angel! Look at hin! All their eyes turn to the Arab servant boy, who is now crouched on the table like a gargoyle. As they watch he transforms inte the young Archangel from the Idumaea desert. His black spiked wings rise above his back.

dialogues.speaker: JUDAS
dialogues.text: (continuing) Satan. {to Jesus) Shame on you, traitor. The others join in. They spit at Jesus' feet and call him names: “coward,” "traitor."

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: We believed in you. You betrayed us. They turn and leave in a group. Jesus is alone with Satan Jesus looks at the great Archangel. Satan floats off the table and heads toward the door.

dialogues.speaker: SATAN
dialogues.text: Goodbye, Jesus of Nazareth. I told you we would meet again. Satan walks into the night. All is silence. Jesus looks around the room. After a moment, Jesus walks through the open door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus steps on the deserted street. The village is still. There is a red glow in the distance: Jerusalem is burning He surveys the empty street. Blood still stains his hands and feet. The old man gets on his hands and knees in the middle of road. He lifts his head toward heaven.

dialogues.speaker: JESUS
dialogues.text: Abba, father, will you still listen to me? Are you still there? (MORE) (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: JESUS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Will you listen to a selfish, unfaithful son? I fought you when you called. I resisted. I thought I knew more. I didn't want to be your.son. Can you forgive me? I didn't fight hard enough. I want to take your hand; I want to save my fellow men. Father, take me back. Kill the fatted calf. I want to be your son. I want to pay the price. I want to be crucified and rise again. I want to be the Messiah. Suddenly the sky turns pale blue. Jesus locks around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus is back on the cross, 37 years before. He has regained his 33 year-old Nazarene form. (He is again the original actor who plays Jesus.) The earth is shaking. Spectators are running. Jesus is racked with pain. He screams:

dialogues.speaker: JESUS
dialogues.text: - lama sabachthani! Jesus looks around, realizes where he is. The past thirty seven years have been a dream. He has resisted the last temptation. He looks to heaven and says:

dialogues.speaker: JESUS
dialogues.text: (continuing) It is finished.
